description: 2^a(n) is smallest power of 2 beginning with n.
references: A. M. Yaglom and I. M. Yaglom, Challenging Mathematical Problems With Elementary Solutions, Vol. 1 pp. 29; 199-200 Prob. 91a Dover NY 1987
links: Daniel Mondot, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..32699
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = 1, m = Floor[ Log[10, n]]}, While[ Log[10, 2^k] < Floor[ Log[10, n]], k++ ]; While[ Quotient[2^k, 10^(Floor[k*Log[10, 2]] - m)] != n, k++ ]; k]; f[1] = 0;; Array[f, 73] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 02 2009 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (isPrefixOf, findIndex)import Data.Maybe (fromJust)a018856 n =   fromJust $ findIndex (show n `isPrefixOf`) $ map show a000079_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 04 2011
author: _David W. Wilson_
